intro: Alyssum alpestre var. orbiculare, commonly known as the alpine alyssum, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It features compact, low-growing stems with small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. The leaves are typically narrow and slightly hairy, adapted to withstand cold and arid conditions. This plant thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and alpine landscapes. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its prolonged blooming period and ability to attract pollinators.
